description.narrative:
Introduction The Enough Campaign, launched in 2016, is the only worldwide stand-alone gender justice campaign. It seeks to lower social acceptance and prevalence of violence against women and girls (VAWG) by addressing discriminatory social norms, whichreflect the unequal gender power relations that are the fundamental root of VAWG. Currently, the campaign has 30 Oxfam countries participatingacross Africa, Asia, Latin America <(>&<)> Caribbean (LAC) and the Pacific. In Africa, 11 countries[1] are currentlyengaged in the Enough Campaign and at various stages with more expected to join in 2018. As more countries join the campaign, we see an ever-increasing opportunity to maximise impact by coming together and identifying opportunities for joint solidarity and campaigning; and for countries to strategize on how to organize themselves as a collective, identify opportunities for collective action, sharing and learning, as well as build synergies and momentum for the Enough Campaign in Africa. During the Mexico F2F, participants from Africa discussed the need to have a strategic face-to-face meeting to discuss their engagement in Africa and develop an Africa-wide strategy for the Enough Campaign that would guide countries in their national campaigning and linktheir national campaigns to continental andworldwide initiatives and debates on ending VAWG and enable them to contribute their experience and learnings on challenging socialnorms that reinforce VAWG while creating visibility for the national campaignsand their partners work.
Africa Regional Strategic Meeting The Africa Regional Strategic Meeting will be hosted in Nairobi, Kenya on 2-4 July 2018. The regional strategic meeting will be an opportunity to Enough Africa countries to come together to develop an Africa-wide strategy for the campaign, identify ways of working and collaboration across the continent and identify moment for joint solidarity. Key objectives: # Listen and reflect on theviews of regional feminist networks on the role / value-add of Oxfam campaigning on EVAWG across the continent. # Develop a 2-year Africa-wide strategy for the Enough Campaign with one-year action plan # Explore opportunities for effective and creative campaigning in Africa # Explore possible opportunities for joint action and solidarity (Key moments <(>&<)> spike for Africa) # Discuss and agree on ways of working together as the Africa Enough Campaign group

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam International was formed in 1995 by a group of independent non-governmental organizations. Their aim was to work together forgreater impact on the international stage to reduce poverty and injustice. The name "Oxfam" comes from the Oxford Committee for Famine Relief, founded in Britain in 1942. The group campaigned for food supplies to be sent through an allied naval blockade to starving women and children in enemy-occupied Greece during the Second World War. As well as becoming a world leader in the delivery of emergency relief, Oxfam International implements long-term development programs in vulnerable communities. We are also part of a global movement, campaigning with others, for instance, to end unfair trade rules, demand better health and education services for all, and to combat climate change. Today, there are 19 member organizations of the Oxfam International confederation. They are based in: Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Great Britain, Hong Kong, Ireland, India, Italy, Japan, Mexico, The Netherlands, New Zealand, Quebec, South Africa, Spain and the United States. The Oxfam International Secretariat is based in Oxford, UK. The Secretariat runs advocacy offices in Addis Ababa, Brussels, Geneva, New York and Washington DC.
